docs.title: EPMware Quick Start Guide
docs.text: Welcome to the EPMware Quick Start Guide. This guide contains the high-level steps required to create and configure your first EPMware application. For detailed instructions on performing each step, please refer to the Administrator's Guide.

docs.title: About This Guide
docs.text: This Quick Start Guide provides a streamlined path to get your EPMware application up and running quickly. Follow the steps in sequence to ensure proper configuration.

docs.title: Quick Setup Overview
docs.text:
The following high-level steps are required to configure your first EPMware application:

  1. Add a Target Application Server - Configure connection to your target systems
  2. Create an EPMware Application - Set up your first application
  3. Change Security for Default Admin User - Secure your installation
  4. Update Global Settings - Configure email and application settings
  5. Start Services - Activate required services
  6. Create a Workflow - Design your approval process
  7. Create a Deployment - Set up deployment configuration

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before beginning the setup process, ensure you have:

  • Administrator access to EPMware
  • Target application server credentials
  • Email server configuration details

docs.title: Navigation
docs.text:
Use the navigation menu on the left to access each configuration section. Each section includes:

  • Step-by-step instructions
  • Configuration screenshots
  • Important notes and tips
  • Troubleshooting guidance

docs.title: Getting Help
docs.text:
If you need assistance during the setup process:

  • Consult the detailed Administrator's Guide
  • Contact EPMware Support at support@epmware.com
  • Call us at 408-614-0442

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
Ready to begin? Start with Getting Started to review the complete setup process, or jump directly to Configuration to begin adding your target application server.

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text: This section covers the initial configuration steps for setting up your EPMware application, including adding target application servers and creating your first application.

docs.title: Add Target Application Server
docs.text: The first step in configuring EPMware is to add your target application server. This establishes the connection between EPMware and your EPM systems.

docs.title: Steps to Add Server
docs.text:
1. Navigate to Configuration → Infrastructure → Servers
  2. Click the Add Server button
  3. Enter the server configuration details

Server configuration dialog

docs.title: Server Configuration Fields
docs.text:
Field Description Required Server Name Unique identifier for the server Yes Server Type Type of EPM application (e.g., Planning, Essbase) Yes Server URL Full URL including protocol and port Yes Username Administrative user for the target system Yes Password Password for the administrative user Yes Identity Key Indentity Key No

Username Case Sensitivity

The username field is case-sensitive. Ensure you enter it exactly as configured in your target system.

docs.title: Test Connection
docs.text:
After entering the server details:

  1. Click Test Connection to verify connectivity
  2. Review any error messages
  3. Save the configuration once the test is successful

docs.title: Create EPMware Application
docs.text: After adding the target server, create your EPMware application.

docs.title: Application Creation Steps
docs.text:
1. Navigate to Configuration → Application → Configure
  2. Click the Add Application button
  3. Input the application properties
  4. Click Save
  5. Select the Properties Tab and select the new Application from the drop down
  6. Update the Properties as required
  7. Select the Configuration Tab and click Import
  8. Choose Manual Import or Auto Import

Application creation dialog

docs.title: Import Progress
docs.text:
During import:

  • Progress bar shows completion status
  • Log displays current operations
  • Errors are highlighted in red
  • Warnings appear in yellow

Import Best Practices

  • Review import logs for any warnings
  • Verify imported data before proceeding

docs.title: Common Configuration Issues
docs.text:
Server Connection Fails

  • Verify network connectivity
  • Check firewall rules
  • Confirm server URL format
  • Validate credentials

Application Creation Errors

  • Ensure unique application name
  • Check for special characters
  • Verify server selection
  • Review error logs

Import Failures

  • Check source system availability
  • Verify user permissions

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
After completing the configuration:

  1. Proceed to Security to update admin credentials
  2. Configure Global Settings
  3. Start required Services

docs.title: Deployment
docs.text:
The Deployment module manages the promotion of approved metadata changes to target EPM applications. This section covers creating and scheduling deployments.

Deployment configuration

docs.title: Understanding Deployments
docs.text:
Deployments in EPMware:

  • Transfer approved changes to target systems
  • Maintain audit trails of all deployments
  • Support scheduled and immediate deployments
  • Provide rollback capabilities
  • Generate deployment reports

docs.title: Create Deployment
docs.text: To create a new deployment configuration:

docs.title: Access Deployment Module
docs.text:
1. Navigate to Deployment from the main menu
  2. The deployment dashboard displays existing deployments
  3. Click the Add button to create a new deployment

docs.title: Schedule Deployment
docs.text: After creating a deployment, configure when it should run.

docs.title: Scheduling Options
docs.text: Click the Schedule button to set up deployment timing:

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: This section provides an overview of the EPMware configuration process and the sequence of steps required to successfully set up your first application.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The EPMware Quick Start Guide walks you through the essential configuration steps to get your master data management and workflow system operational. Each step builds upon the previous one, so it's important to follow them in sequence.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text: Before you begin the configuration process, ensure you have the following:

docs.title: System Requirements
docs.text:
• Supported web browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, or Edge)
  • Sufficient system permissions for configuration

docs.title: Required Information
docs.text:
Gather the following information before starting:

  • Target Application Credentials
  • Server URL/hostname
  • Administrator username and password

  • Port numbers (if non-standard)

  • Email Configuration

  • Email authentication credentials
  • From email address

  • Reply-to address (optional)

  • Organization Details

  • Organization name
  • EPMware application URL

docs.title: User Access
docs.text: You'll need: - Administrator role in EPMware - Access to create and modify applications - Permissions to configure security settings

docs.title: Configuration Checklist
docs.text:
Use this checklist to track your progress:

  • [ ] Target application server added
  • [ ] EPMware application created
  • [ ] Application properties configured
  • [ ] Configuration imported (manual or auto)
  • [ ] Admin password changed
  • [ ] Admin email address updated
  • [ ] Email settings configured
  • [ ] Application URL set
  • [ ] Services started
  • [ ] Workflow tasks created
  • [ ] Workflow stages defined
  • [ ] Deployment created
  • [ ] Deployment scheduled

docs.title: Time Estimate
docs.text:
A typical first-time configuration takes approximately:

  • Basic setup: 30-45 minutes
  • Including workflow design: 1-2 hours
  • Full configuration with testing: 2-4 hours

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
Configuration Tips

  • Document all configuration settings for future reference
  • Test email settings immediately after configuration
  • Create a simple test workflow before designing complex processes
  • Back up your configuration after completing setup

Security Reminder

Always change the default admin password immediately after installation to maintain security.

docs.title: Connection Problems
docs.text: If you cannot connect to the target application: - Verify network connectivity - Check firewall settings - Confirm credentials are correct - Ensure the server URL includes the correct protocol (http/https)

docs.title: Email Issues
docs.text: If emails are not being sent: - Check authentication credentials - Ensure the from address is valid - Review spam filters

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
Once you've reviewed the prerequisites and understand the setup process, proceed to Configuration to begin adding your target application server.

For detailed instructions on any step, consult the Administrator's Guide.

docs.title: Global Settings
docs.text: Global Settings configure system-wide parameters that affect all users and applications in EPMware. These settings include email configuration, application URLs, and user-defined fields.

docs.title: Accessing Global Settings
docs.text:
To access Global Settings:

  1. Navigate to Misc → Global
  2. The Global Settings page displays with multiple configuration tabs

.

Global Settings configuration interface

docs.title: Email Settings
docs.text: Email settings control how EPMware sends notifications, alerts, and system messages to users.

docs.title: Configuration Fields
docs.text: Setting Description Required Example Append Fixed value for Email Subject (Prefix) Prefix to distinguish environment in email subjects No TEST, PROD, DEV From Email Address Sender address for all system emails Yes admin@epmware.com Override Email Address Redirect all emails to this address (for testing) No test@epmware.com

docs.title: Override Email Address
docs.text: The Override Email Address is useful for: - Testing email functionality - Training environments - Development systems - Preventing emails to end users during testing

docs.title: Application Settings
docs.text: Application settings define core system parameters and URLs.

docs.title: Configuration Options
docs.text:
Setting Description Required Example EPMware Application URL Full URL of the EPMware application Yes https://demo.epmwarecloud.com Organization Name Your company/organization name No Acme Corporation

URL Format

Always include the full URL with protocol (https://) and do not include a trailing slash.

docs.title: User Defined Fields (UDF)
docs.text:
User Defined Fields allow customization of EPMware to capture organization-specific information.

User Defined Fields configuration

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
After configuring Global Settings:

  1. Start required services
  2. Create workflows
  3. Set up deployments
  4. Test end-to-end process flow

docs.title: Security
docs.text: This section covers essential security configuration steps, including changing the default admin user credentials and setting up email authentication.

docs.title: Default Admin User
docs.text:
EPMware comes with a default admin user account that must be secured immediately after installation. This is a critical security step that should not be delayed.

Security Alert

The default admin account uses a well-known password. Change it immediately to prevent unauthorized access to your EPMware system.

docs.title: Change Password
docs.text: Follow these steps to update the default admin user credentials:

docs.title: Access User Management
docs.text:
1. Navigate to Security → Users
  2. Locate the Admin user in the user list
  3. Right-click on the Admin user row
  4. Select Edit User from the context menu

docs.title: Update Credentials
docs.text:
In the Edit User dialog:

  1. Change Password
  2. Enter a new strong password
  3. Confirm the new password

  4. Follow password complexity requirements

  5. Update Email Address

  6. Replace default email with administrator's email
  7. This email receives system notifications

docs.title: Password Requirements
docs.text:
Your new password should meet these criteria:

Requirement Description Length Minimum 8 characters Uppercase At least one uppercase letter Lowercase At least one lowercase letter Numbers At least one numeric digit Special Characters At least one special character (!@#$%^&*) Uniqueness Cannot match previous 5 passwords

Password Best Practices

  • Use a password manager to generate and store strong passwords
  • Avoid using personal information
  • Don't reuse passwords from other systems
  • Change passwords regularly (every 90 days recommended)

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
After securing the admin account:

  1. Configure Global Settings including email settings
  2. Create additional user accounts
  3. Set up roles and permissions
  4. Enable audit logging

docs.title: Services
docs.text: EPMware uses background services to handle various system operations including deployments, workflow processing, and ERP imports. These services must be started after initial configuration.

docs.title: Starting Services
docs.text:
To start the required services:

  1. Navigate to Administration → Services
  2. Review the service status dashboard
  3. Start each required service

Services management interface

docs.title: Required Services to Start
docs.text:
Click the Start button for each of these essential services:

  1. Deployment Service - Handles metadata deployment to target systems
  2. ERP Import Service - Manages data imports from ERP systems
  3. Workflow Service - Processes workflow approvals and routing

Service Start Order

Services should be started in the order listed above to ensure proper initialization.

docs.title: Deployment Service
docs.text:
The Deployment Service manages the promotion of metadata changes to target EPM applications.

Functions:

  • Processes deployment requests
  • Validates metadata before deployment
  • Handles rollback operations
  • Generates deployment logs
  • Sends deployment notifications

docs.title: ERP Import Service
docs.text:
The ERP Import Service handles integration with ERP systems for master data synchronization.

Functions:

  • Scheduled data imports
  • Data validation and transformation
  • Error handling and reporting
  • Import history tracking
  • Notification of import status

docs.title: Workflow Service
docs.text:
The Workflow Service processes approval workflows and manages request routing.

Functions:

  • Routes requests through approval stages
  • Sends approval notifications
  • Tracks workflow history

docs.title: Service Status Indicators
docs.text:
Services display status using color-coded indicators:

Status Color Description Running Green Service is active and processing Stopped Red Service is not running

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
After starting services:

  1. Create your first workflow
  2. Configure deployment settings
  3. Test end-to-end process flow
  4. Monitor service performance

docs.title: Related Topics
docs.text:
• Workflow Configuration
  • Deployment Setup

docs.title: Workflow
docs.text:
Workflows in EPMware define the approval process for metadata changes. A workflow consists of stages containing tasks that must be completed in sequence.

Workflow Builder

docs.title: Understanding Workflows
docs.text:
A Workflow is comprised of:

  • Stages: Sequential steps in the approval process
  • Tasks: Actions assigned to stages (review, approve, validate)
  • Approvers and Reviewers: Users or groups responsible for tasks

docs.title: Create Workflow Tasks
docs.text: Before creating a workflow, define the tasks that will be used in workflow stages.

docs.title: Steps to Create Tasks
docs.text:
1. Navigate to Workflow → Tasks
  2. Click the Add button
  3. Configure task properties
  4. Save the task

docs.title: Create Workflow
docs.text: After defining tasks, create the workflow structure.

docs.title: Workflow Creation Steps
docs.text:
1. Navigate to Workflow → Builder
  2. Click the Add button to create a new workflow

docs.title: Add Stages
docs.text: Stages define the sequential steps in your workflow.

docs.title: Creating Stages
docs.text:
1. With your workflow selected, click the Stage Menu button
  2. Select Add Stage
  3. Configure stage properties:
Property Description Example Stage # Sequence order (defines flow) 1, 2, 3... Stage Name Descriptive stage name Initial Review Required Approvals Number needed to proceed All, Any, Specific #

docs.title: Assign Tasks to Stages
docs.text: Add tasks to stages to define what actions occur at each step.

docs.title: Task Assignment Process
docs.text:
1. Select a stage in the workflow designer
  2. Click Add Task to Stage
  3. Choose from available tasks
Setting Description Options Task Select predefined task Dropdown list

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text: After creating workflows: 1. Set up deployment configuration
